content: stash basket a handy basket to stash your stuff size height x base 15 5cm x 19cm yarn requirements 1 ball each in two colours of rosarios bouquet or spray 18ply cotton 85m/100g hook 6mm gauge 11 5 sts and 14 row to 10cm in uk double_crochet notions 1 stitch marker large eye yarn needle abbreviations chain chain sts stiches double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch dc2 double_crochet in next two sts r1 round 1 increase increase work two double_crochet in next st round - round notes - this pattern is written using uk crochet terminology - when using your stitch marker continue to move it into the first st of each round so it travels up with you - when changing colour it s a good idea to work over your tails as you go as they can be tricky to sew in with the thick yarn © emily bolduan 2016 pattern r1 ch2 work 6 double_crochet in 1st chain place marker 6sts work base r2 increase in each st to end 12sts r8 increase in next st dc6 6 times 48 r3 increase in next st double_crochet 6 times 18sts r9 increase in next st dc7 6 times 54 r4 increase in next st dc2 6 times 24 r10 increase in next st dc8 6 times 60 r5 increase in next st dc3 6 times 30 r11 increase in next st dc9 6 times 66 r6 increase in next st dc4 6 times 36 r12 increase in next st dc10 6 times 72 r7 increase in next st dc5 6 times 42 work the sides side setup double_crochet in back loops to 1 st before marker dc1 as normal double_crochet in each st to end repeat this until you run out of yarn approx 7 rounds change to second colour place marker for new starting point double_crochet in each st to end repeat for 9 more rounds next round dc24 ch12 skip 12dc repeat once more next round dc24 dc12 into chain space repeat once more double_crochet in each st to end repeat one more round double_crochet in next 2 sts slip_stitch in next fasten_off to finish just weave in the ends and admire your handiwork © emily bolduan 2016
